intro: Ageratina parayana, commonly known as the white mistflower, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant produces small, white to pale blue flowers that are clustered in dense, fluffy inflorescences. Its leaves are typically opposite, lance-shaped, and covered in fine hairs. Ageratina parayana is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories and stream banks.
